attributes.action: Refund fees for A-level & GCSE entries from examination boards
attributes.background:
Schools are doing the bulk of the work to decide this year’s grades following the decision to scrap exams.
Therefore examination boards should refund the fees charged for A-level and GCSE entries this summer.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about refunding exam fees are a matter for individual exam boards, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to reimburse schools for exam board fees for the last two academic years, if that's what you want to happen.
